Freshers party? Lmao.

All incoming PESts' parents are sent an email in the first month or so about their children taking part in illegal activities and parties and to keep an eye on their children. It's a canon event. If someone has, they can paste the email here for you to read.

Dear Students and Parents,



It has come to our notice that a group of students claiming to be higher semester students are hosting a 'Freshers' Party', in private places. 



Please note that all such activities are illegal and have no approval from the University.



Please do not be part of such activities which could put you in a wrong group and lead you to a situation of no return. Such activities are normally organised by a set of people trying to collect money from gullible students and in places which are unsafe and dangerous.



We have noticed such activities in the past and have reported the same to the concerned authorities, who have taken effective steps to stop them from happening, where our own students would land up as victims.



The Vice-Chancellor, Registrar and Dean, Student Affairs, PES University, have been informed about this activity. Parents are also informed, to inform their wards to stay away from such activities.



Stay informed, keep away from these nefarious activities and stay safe.



Regards,

PES University
